steps.title: Identify the person you believe merits targeting
steps.text: Build an intelligence dossier (at one point called "electronic targeting folders" or "disposition matrix") explaining on what basis this person is believed to be a member of an "organized armed group" posing a "continuing, imminent threat."
steps.caveats: We don’t know how the government specifically picks its targets, beyond that it uses the intelligence community’s considerable resources.

steps.title: Vet the name and available intelligence
steps.text: Share it with other intelligence agencies. If the target is a U.S. citizen, send the name to the U.S. Department of Justice for additional vetting.
steps.caveats: We don’t know the precise procedures intelligence agencies use to approve a person for targeting. We also don’t know how secret executive policies could affect this process.
